maml:description.maml:para: Retrieve author(s) from the VMware VMTN Community
Retrieve one or more authors from the VMware VMTN Community. The author selection can be filtered by creation and last update dates, and the number of returned authors can be limited in number.

maml:Description.maml:para: The displayname of one or more authors. There is limited support in Jive for meta-characters in the searchname.
A filter to limit the returned authors to those created after this date.
A filter to limit the returned authors to those created before this date.
A filter to limit the returned authors to those whose profile was last updated after this date.
A filter to limit the returned authors to those whose entry was last updated before this date.
A filter to limit the returned authors to those whose profile was last updated after this date.
A filter to limit the returned authors to those whose profile was last updated before this date.
Limits the number of returned authors. The default is 100.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.

The default Jive search returns all authors whose beginning of their name matches the searchname. With this switch, a case-insensitive exact match of the author's name with one of the searchnames is required.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
The displayname of one or more authors. There is limited support in Jive for meta-characters in the searchname.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
A filter to limit the returned authors to those created after this date.
A filter to limit the returned authors to those created before this date.

The default Jive search returns all authors whose beginning of their name matches the searchname. With this switch, a case-insensitive exact match of the author's name with one of the searchnames is required.
Limits the number of returned authors. The default is 100.
A filter to limit the returned authors to those whose profile was last updated before this date.
A filter to limit the returned authors to those whose profile was last updated after this date.
A filter to limit the returned authors to those whose entry was last updated before this date.
A filter to limit the returned authors to those whose profile was last updated after this date.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Retrieves 100, the default for MaxSamples, authors.
Retrieves all authors created in the last 7 days
Retrieves all authors whose name starts with 'lucd' (the match is done case-insensitive)
Retrieves the author whose name exactly matches (case-insensitive).
Retrieves two authors whose names exactly match. Note how Jive supports a limited set of meta-characters in the search text.

maml:description.maml:para: Retrieve one or more communities from the VMware VMTN Community

maml:Description.maml:para: One or more searchnames.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
This switch will only return communities whose name matches exactly (case-insensitive) with thw searchnames.
Include blogs from authors.
Include communities.
Include user-created VMTN groups
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
One or more searchnames.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
This switch will only return communities whose name matches exactly (case-insensitive) with thw searchnames.
Include blogs from authors.
Include communities.
Include user-created VMTN groups
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Returns all public VMTN communities that are having the work 'PowerCLI' in their name or description. The search is done case-insensitive

Returns all public VMTN communities and groups, that are having the work 'PowerCLI' in their name or description. The search is done case-insensitive A group is a VMTN entry created by an individual author.
Returns all VMTN bogs whose name or description matches the searchname. The search is done case-insensitive There will be no communities returned.

maml:description.maml:para: Retrieve thread(s) from the VMware VMTN Community
Retrieve one or more threads from the VMware VMTN Community. The thread selection can be filtered by keywords, creation date, type, community and author.

maml:Description.maml:para: One or more keywords that shall be present in the returned threads
A DateTime value which marks a date after which the returned threads are published.
A DateTime value which marks a date before which the returned threads are published.
Filters the returned threads by the author's name
A filter that allows you to specify the community in which the threads are posted.
Specify which type of threads shall be returned. The types can be discussion, document or post.

The returned threads can be sorted in three ways: by relevance (default) and by the last update date. This last one can be done in ascending and descending order. The relevance order always returns the thread with highest relevance first.
Limit on the number of returned threads. The default is 100
Switch to specify that the author name should be an exact match
Switch to specify that the community name shall be an exact match
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
When a community is defined to limit the number of returned threads, this switch indicates that also matching threads in sub-communities shall be returned.
By default the cmdlet looks for matching keywords in the subject and the content of a thread. This switch limits the search to only the subject of the thread.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Filters the returned threads by the author's name
Switch to specify that the author name should be an exact match
A filter that allows you to specify the community in which the threads are posted.
Switch to specify that the community name shall be an exact match
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Specify which type of threads shall be returned. The types can be discussion, document or post.
A DateTime value which marks a date before which the returned threads are published.
One or more keywords that shall be present in the returned threads
Limit on the number of returned threads. The default is 100
When a community is defined to limit the number of returned threads, this switch indicates that also matching threads in sub-communities shall be returned.
By default the cmdlet looks for matching keywords in the subject and the content of a thread. This switch limits the search to only the subject of the thread.

The returned threads can be sorted in three ways: by relevance (default) and by the last update date. This last one can be done in ascending and descending order. The relevance order always returns the thread with highest relevance first.
A DateTime value which marks a date after which the returned threads are published.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Return MaxSample (default is 100) threads that contain the keywork in the subject or content of the thread.
Return MaxSample (default is 100) threads that contain the keywork in the subject or content of the thread. The returned threads are limited to the specified community.
Return MaxSample (default is 100) threads that contain the keywork in the subject or content of the thread. The returned threads are limited to the specified community and it's sub-communities.
Return MaxSample (default is 100) threads that contain the keywork in the subject or content of the thread. The returned threads are limited to the time between the start and finish dates.
Return MaxSample (default is 100) threads that contain the keywork in the subject of the thread. The returned threads are limited to the specified community.
Return MaxSample (default is 100) threads that contain the keywork in the subject of the thread. The returned threads are limited to the specified community.

maml:description.maml:para: Initialises the environment to allow REST API calls to the VMware VMTN Community.

Initialises the environment to allow REST API calls to the VMware VMTN Community. Currently authentication is not possible with Jive and the VMTN user accounts. This means that you can only query "public" communities.

maml:Description.maml:para: Define a Proxy over which all REST API calls to the VMTN community shall be made.
The part of the URI that defines the location of the VMware VMTN community. The default is 'https://communities.vmware.com'
The REST specific part of the URI to access the VMware VMTN community. The default is 'api/core/v3'
The maximum number of objects that one call to the Jive REST API shall return. The number shall be a value between 1 and 100 (the default).
The REST specific part of the URI to access the VMware VMTN community. The default is 'api/core/v3'
The maximum number of objects that one call to the Jive REST API shall return. The number shall be a value between 1 and 100 (the default).
Define a Proxy over which all REST API calls to the VMTN community shall be made.
The part of the URI that defines the location of the VMware VMTN community. The default is 'https://communities.vmware.com'

dev:remarks.maml:para: Initialises the environment for calls to the VMTN REST API
Initialises the environment for calls to the VMTN REST API, and specifies a proxy server.
